sentences.english: Residential carpenters erect all types of homes, including apartments and townhouses.
sentences.chinese: 住宅木匠會建造各式各樣的房屋，例如公寓和市政廳。

sentences.english: Will you tell me the way to City Hall?
sentences.chinese: 請你告訴我去市政廳該怎麼走好嗎？

sentences.english: The council house is planning to develop the area to the east of the town centre.
sentences.chinese: 市政廳計劃開發市中心以東的地區。

sentences.english: He takes unfiltered questions at endless town hall meetings.
sentences.chinese: 他在無休止的市政廳集會上接受各種未經篩選的問題。

sentences.english: I see so many trucks bringing stones for the building.
sentences.chinese: 我看到有很多卡車運來石頭來建市政廳。

sentences.english: A clerk in her local town hall, Ms.
sentences.chinese: 費瑞格夫人是當地市政廳的一名接待員。

sentences.english: In addition, it is very costly to heat the old hall in winter and cool it in summer.
sentences.chinese: 而且，舊市政廳冬天採暖和夏天製冷都很花錢。

sentences.english: The new bingo hall stands four-square to the old town hall.
sentences.chinese: 那個新建的賓戈娛樂廳屹立在舊市政廳的正前方。

sentences.english: Yes, she works at the townhouse in the morning, and takes care of our son at home in the afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 是的，她早上到市政廳工作，下午則在家裏帶兒子。

sentences.english: One of the main starling roosts is on top of the Town Hall.
sentences.chinese: 市政廳的房頂是星椋鳥的一個主要棲息處。

sentences.english: It is illegal to tie a horse in front of city hall.
sentences.chinese: 將馬系在市政廳前面是違法的。

sentences.english: In the past, we used to gather under the Town Hall clock to welcome the New Year.
sentences.chinese: 我們過去常聚集在市政廳的大鐘下面迎新年。

sentences.english: He gave libraries to Guildhall and Greyfairs.
sentences.chinese: 他給市政廳和交易所建了圖書館。

sentences.english: There have been scuffles at such venues across America in recent days.
sentences.chinese: 最近幾天在美國各地的市政廳都時有鬥毆事件發生。

sentences.english: Does this street go to City Hall?
sentences.chinese: 這條街是往市政廳的嗎？

sentences.english: On the right side, opposite of the City Hall, is the statue of Andersen in Tivoli Park.
sentences.chinese: 市政廳對面右側，是面對着趣伏裏公園的安徒生雕像。

definition: building (a relatively large, multi-storey one)/CL:幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
Santiago, capital of Chile/San Diego, California
Chinatown/also called 唐人街[Tang2 ren2 jie1]
Brooklyn, borough of New York City
Roosevelt (name)/Theodore Roosevelt (1858-1919), US President 1901-1909/Franklin D. Roosevelt (1882-1945), US President 1933-1945
